question.title: {"sections": [{"spans": [{"text": "Why do people use their minority status as their identifiers rather than happenstance?", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}]}

credentials.translatedString: M.A. Graduate School Education & English, University of Pittsburgh

answer.content: {"sections": [{"spans": [{"text": "You must be asking this because you are white.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "Let\u2019s do a thought experiment. Imagine that you are black, not just black, but African. You\u2019ve lived most of your life in the country of your birth. The vast majority of people around you are of your race. Your race, for you, is about as consequential as the fact that you have two elbows. It\u2019s just something you can take for granted. You\u2019re not going to have run-ins with the criminal justice system because you look suspicious to a police officer. You will be aware of your race, because you will have learned about colonization, and because most of the movies you watch will have White actors, but day-to-day, your race won\u2019t be meaningful to you.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "Imagine that you move to a country where blacks constitute a minority of the population. Initially, you might still not want to think about race. You will keep your own mindset and decide that race is about complexion and nothing more. But soon, you will notice a couple of things:", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "No matter what you tell yourself about what you are, ", "modifiers": {}}, {"text": "others", "modifiers": {"italic": true}}, {"text": " in the majority, no matter what they say with their words, clearly see you as a black person blackly blacking your black way around the world. It\u2019s something you might try to deny at first, but this will get harder the seventh time you are followed around in a store because the associates think you look suspicious, or when you are told to your face that the fact that you\u2019re holding hands with a white person is disgusting.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "ordered-list", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "When you talk about your experiences, it will be very common for your white interlocutors to respond in one or more of the following ways:", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "ordered-list", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "Telling you that you can\u2019t prove that it was about racism.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 1, "quoted": false, "type": "ordered-list", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "Reflexively striving to find a million reasons why your experience couldn\u2019t possibly have been about racism.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 1, "quoted": false, "type": "ordered-list", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "Implying that you are whining or making excuses for your own poor behavior.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 1, "quoted": false, "type": "ordered-list", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "Being more concerned with holding on to their view of racism as a thing of the past than with acknowledging what you went through.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 1, "quoted": false, "type": "ordered-list", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "The result of this will be that even if you don\u2019t start out that way, you will end up with a very acute sense of your blackness.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "Talking about racism is a very thankless task. This is why my forays into discussions about race are few and far between. I also feel that I am doing more for perceptions of blacks by talking about topics like medicine, healthcare policy, politics, and history than I would if a greater proportion of my content were about race.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "But very few blacks in the US have the luxury of not thinking about their race.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}]}
